medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has a history of diabetes mellitus (DM) for 11 years requiring insulin. Her symptoms related to exercise began to develop more noticeably around the time of consultation. She reported a duration of exercise from 7 to 12 minutes with fatigue causing her to stop. Prior to initiating CoQ10 therapy, she experienced 'aching muscles' throughout the day and night, which improved significantly after starting the treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of gestational diabetes (GDM) diagnosed at age 23 and recurrent GDM at age 25. She was diagnosed with Wolf-Parkinson-White syndrome at age 19, experiencing several episodes of tachycardia. She has a documented proteinuria predating her onset of DM by 8 years.
medical_history.family_history: The proband is part of a kindred where four of seven siblings have adult-onset DM and sensorineural hearing loss. Her familial history includes a maternal grandmother with obesity and hypertension, and a father diagnosed with type 2 DM at age 66.
medical_history.social_history: The proband is a rancher in a rural setting, engaging in physically demanding activities regularly, such as lifting 50 to 70-pound hay bails.
